attributes.action: Object to the proposed plannning application at 182 Biddulph Road,Chell, for the erection of a fast food takeaway (A5)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: road safety issues especially at biddulph road/oxford road.traffic congestion,speed,volume.close proximity to oxford road/biddulph road junction,close proximity to whitfield valley school and crossing patrol site,childrens safety especially at crossing patrol site.over intensification on the appellant's land.environmental issues eg vermin/odours/noise.increase in litter,quality of life decreased for residents,late night noise created by customers & car door slamming,increase in existing anti-social behaviour problems.intimidation of young & elderly.potential late night fast food takeaway delivery service,potential offending and potential victims.drug abuse-dealing and using.drunks.lack of police resoures.car parking is insufficient to facilitate customers,staff & disabled.atm machine on site. takeaway would be open before the school closes for the day causing added danger to children.this is a residential area first and foremost. residents do not want a takeaway it would have a detrimental effect on the area.

rejection.details: Planning decisions are devolved to local authorities. At this early stage in an application, the PM/Government cannot step in and object.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
